comments.body: for posterity, this remains compatible because a custom unmarshaler was implemented to remain case insensitive
Should this be names of pods? Again, assumption that extender gets the pods from apiserver.
Name of pod is not unique. We need namespace at least.
Yes, size of the message becomes an issue when we included the whole struct. Pod Name, Namespace, UUID should suffice. UUID is important to keep the extender in sync.
Not very sure if this is overkill, cc @bsalamat any experience of victim list size to see if we need to pass pod name list instead?

Sending only Pod identifiers (name, namspace, UUID) is fine with me. Generally speaking, we don't expect the list of victims to be long, probably only several pods, but given that many nodes may be chosen as possible preemption candidates in larger clusters, limiting the information we pass can help improve performance.
